    • Method Detail

      • createEndPoint

        INetaxept createEndPoint(Optional<String> merchantId)

      • registerTransaction

        public PaymentRegisterResponse registerTransaction(PaymentRegisterRequest request,
                                                   Map<String,String> additionalData)
         Registers a payment transaction at Netaxept
 
 Important parameters:
 Service type Set to 'M'
 
 Two types of payments using stored card tokens are used, with and without the need for entry of security code.
 
 Without security code
 In Netaxept:
      recurring type set to 'R'
      recurring frequency set to 0
      expiration date set to that of the card
 
 With security code and 3DS
 In Netaxept:
      recurring type set to 'S'
      
 
 For registration only, of a card: order.updateStoredPaymentInfo should be set to true
 
 The following parameters in the Netaxept API are set through configuration properties of this demo backend:
   
   force3Dsecure
   redirectUrl
   cancelUrl
   terminalPaymentMethods
   merchantName
   token
   customerCountry(Paypal only)
        Specified by:
        registerTransaction in interface PspConnector
        See Also:
        Netaxept API - Register

      • setupSynchronization

        private void setupSynchronization(PaymentRegisterRequest request,
                                  RegisterResponse response)
        Setup synchronization. This method creates a lock for payment methods for which callbacks will be issued in the future. These lock are used to synchronize between the threads of the callback and client calls.
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        response - the response

      • authorizeTransaction

        public PaymentProcessResponse authorizeTransaction(PaymentProcessRequest request)
        Two scenarios: 1) the payment method used is such that authorization is done inside a Payment wallet or bank payment. in these cases we need to wait for the Netaxept callback and query for this result. We do not trigger an authorization from here. 2) Process method is called with the operation AUTH This is used for payment methods like e.g. Card.
        Specified by:
        authorizeTransaction in interface PspConnector
        See Also:
        Netaxept API - Process(AUTH)

      • verifyTransaction

        public PaymentProcessResponse verifyTransaction(PaymentProcessRequest request)
        Process method is called with the operation VERIFY
        Specified by:
        verifyTransaction in interface PspConnector
        See Also:
        Netaxept API - Process(VERIFY)

      • finalizeTransaction

        public PaymentProcessResponse finalizeTransaction(PaymentProcessRequest request)
        Process method is called with the operation CAPTURE if finalization is to be done with success, i.e COMMIT Otherwise operation = ANNUL for rolling back
        Specified by:
        finalizeTransaction in interface PspConnector
        See Also:
        Netaxept API - Process(CAPTURE/ANNUL
